footer.tagline: Meijer & Münninghoff Real Estate - Your trusted partner for home finding and relocation services in Amsterdam.

about.title: About Meijer & Münninghoff
about.subtitle: Personal service in the Amsterdam rental market since 2014
about.whoWeAreText1: Meijer & Münninghoff Real Estate is an Amsterdam-based agency specializing in helping expats find their perfect rental home and assisting landlords in finding reliable tenants.
about.whoWeAreText2: Founded in 2014, we combine deep local knowledge with a personal approach. We understand that finding a home is more than just a transaction — it's about finding a place where you can build your life.
about.ourMissionText: To make the Amsterdam rental market accessible and stress-free for everyone, whether you're an expat looking for your first Dutch home or a landlord seeking reliable tenants.
about.personalServiceText: Every client gets dedicated attention from start to finish.
about.localExpertiseText: We know Amsterdam inside and out — neighborhoods, market trends, and regulations.
about.transparencyText: Clear communication and honest advice, always.
about.efficiencyText: We value your time and work quickly without sacrificing quality.
about.readyToWorkText: Whether you're looking for a home or want to rent out your property, we're here to help.

homeFinding.title: Home Finding in Amsterdam
homeFinding.subtitle: Personal guidance for finding your perfect rental home. From intake to key handover, we manage the entire search process for you.

whatIs.title: What is Home Finding?
whatIs.text1: Home finding (also known as aanhuur in Dutch) is a professional service where a rental agent searches for a home on your behalf. Unlike traditional real estate agents who represent landlords, a home finding agent works exclusively for you — the tenant.
whatIs.text2: We handle everything from identifying suitable properties and arranging viewings to negotiating rental terms and reviewing contracts. Our goal is to find you the right home at the right price, as quickly as possible.

homeFinding.audienceSubtitle: Our service is designed for anyone who needs expert help navigating the Amsterdam rental market.

expats.title: Expats & Internationals
expats.description: Moving to the Netherlands and unfamiliar with the Dutch rental market? We guide you through every step.

workers.title: International Workers
workers.description: Relocated by your employer and need a quality home fast? We handle the search while you focus on your job.

entrepreneurs.title: Entrepreneurs
entrepreneurs.description: Starting a business in Amsterdam and need a home base? We find the right neighborhood and property for you.

professionals.title: Busy Professionals
professionals.description: No time to navigate the competitive Amsterdam market yourself? Let our experts do the heavy lifting.

companies.title: Companies
companies.description: Need housing for incoming employees? We offer corporate home finding with dedicated account management.

families.title: Families
families.description: Relocating with children? We factor in schools, parks, and family-friendly neighborhoods.

relocation.title: Relocation Services
relocation.subtitle: End-to-end relocation support for your move to the Netherlands. From immigration to integration, we handle it all.

whatIs.title: What is Relocation?
whatIs.text1: Relocation is a comprehensive service that helps individuals and families move to a new country. It goes beyond just finding a home — it covers everything from immigration paperwork and housing to settling into daily life.
whatIs.text2: At MMRE, we act as your single point of contact for every aspect of your move to the Netherlands. Whether you need help with permits, housing, schools, or just understanding how things work in the Netherlands — we're here for you.

relocation.domainsSubtitle: A complete range of services to cover every aspect of your international move

settlingIn.title: Settling-in Services
settlingIn.subtitle: Municipality registration, BSN, bank account, health insurance, and more — we handle all the essential admin for your new life in the Netherlands.

intro.title: Getting Settled in the Netherlands
intro.text1: Arriving in a new country means dealing with a lot of bureaucracy — from registering at the municipality to setting up health insurance and a bank account. Our settling-in service takes care of all the essential admin so you can focus on your new life.
intro.text2: We guide you through every registration step, prepare your documents, and accompany you to appointments where needed. No Dutch required — we handle the communication.

settlingIn.stepsSubtitle: Every essential registration and setup step — checked off your list

municipality.title: Municipality Registration
municipality.description: We help you register at the municipality (gemeente), which is required for anyone living in the Netherlands.
municipality.detail1: Appointment scheduling at the local municipality

bsn.title: BSN Number
bsn.description: Your BSN (Burger Service Nummer) is your personal identification number — essential for working, banking, and healthcare.
bsn.detail1: Applied for automatically during municipality registration
bsn.detail2: We verify you receive your BSN letter
bsn.detail3: Guidance on when and how to use your BSN

bank.title: Bank Account Opening
bank.description: A Dutch bank account is essential for receiving your salary, paying rent, and handling day-to-day finances.
bank.detail1: Guidance on choosing the right bank
bank.detail4: Setting up direct debits for rent and utilities

health.title: Health Insurance
health.description: Health insurance is mandatory in the Netherlands. We help you understand and choose the right policy.
health.detail1: Explanation of the Dutch healthcare system
health.detail2: Comparison of insurance providers and plans

utilities.title: Utilities & Internet
utilities.description: Getting your home connected with energy, water, internet, and phone services.

additional.title: Additional Registrations
additional.description: Other essential registrations and admin tasks to get fully settled in the Netherlands.

settlingIn.ctaDescription: Let us handle the paperwork and registrations so you can focus on enjoying your new home.

immigration.title: Immigration Support
immigration.subtitle: Residence permits, work permits, 30% ruling, and BSN — we guide you through Dutch immigration step by step.

intro.title: Immigration Support
intro.text1: Moving to the Netherlands involves navigating a complex immigration system. Whether you need a residence permit, work permit, highly skilled migrant visa, or help with the 30% ruling — we provide clear guidance throughout the process.
intro.text2: We work with individuals, families, and employers to ensure all documentation is complete and applications are submitted correctly. Our goal is a smooth, stress-free immigration process.

immigration.audienceSubtitle: Immigration support tailored to your situation

highlySkilled.title: Highly Skilled Migrants
highlySkilled.description: Employed by a recognized sponsor in the Netherlands? We help with your kennismigrant permit application.

international.title: International Employees
international.description: Transferring to a Dutch office? We guide you and your employer through the permit process.

thirtyPercent.title: 30% Ruling Applicants
thirtyPercent.description: Eligible for the 30% tax ruling? We help you apply and maximize your tax benefit.

family.title: Family Members
family.description: Bringing your partner or family? We handle family reunification permit applications.

eu.title: EU/EEA Citizens
eu.description: EU citizens have the right to live and work in the Netherlands, but registration is still required.

entrepreneurs.title: Entrepreneurs
entrepreneurs.description: Starting a business in the Netherlands? We advise on self-employment permits and requirements.

immigration.stepsSubtitle: From eligibility assessment to registration — we guide you through every step

eligibility.title: Eligibility Assessment
eligibility.description: We review your situation to determine which permits and rulings you qualify for.

documents.title: Document Preparation
documents.description: We help you gather, prepare, and verify all required documentation.

permit.title: Permit Application
permit.description: We guide you through the IND (Immigration and Naturalization Service) application process.

thirtyPercent.title: 30% Ruling Application
thirtyPercent.description: For eligible employees, we help apply for the 30% tax ruling to reduce your tax burden.

registration.title: BSN & Registration
registration.description: Once your permit is granted, we help with municipality registration and BSN collection.

immigration.ctaDescription: Tell us about your situation and we'll advise on the best path forward.

familyIntegration.title: Family & Integration
familyIntegration.subtitle: Schools, childcare, partner support, and cultural integration — helping your entire family settle into life in the Netherlands.

intro.title: Making the Whole Family Feel at Home
intro.text1: Relocating is a family affair. While finding a home and handling immigration are essential first steps, true integration means making sure every family member — from children to accompanying partners — feels comfortable and connected in their new environment.
intro.text2: Our family and integration services cover education, childcare, career support for partners, cultural orientation, and building a social network. Because a successful relocation means the whole family thrives.

familyIntegration.domainsSubtitle: Comprehensive integration support for every family member

schools.title: International Schools
schools.description: We research and shortlist international schools that match your children's age, language, and educational needs. We assist with applications and enrollment.

childcare.title: Childcare & After-School
childcare.description: Finding quality daycare (kinderdagverblijf), after-school care (BSO), and nannies. We explain the Dutch childcare system and available subsidies.

partner.title: Partner Career Support
partner.description: Career guidance for accompanying partners including job market orientation, networking tips, and professional development resources.

cultural.title: Cultural Integration
cultural.description: Understanding Dutch culture, social customs, and everyday life. From cycling etiquette to birthday traditions — we help you fit in.

language.title: Language & Community
language.description: Dutch language course recommendations, expat community groups, and social clubs to help you build a network in your new city.

activities.title: Activities & Enrichment
activities.description: Sports clubs, music lessons, hobby groups, and extracurricular activities for both children and adults in your neighborhood.

familyIntegration.ctaDescription: Tell us about your family situation and we'll help make the transition smooth for everyone.

corporate.title: Corporate Relocation
corporate.subtitle: Dedicated relocation management for companies bringing international talent to the Netherlands.

whyChoose.title: Why Companies Choose MMRE
whyChoose.text1: Relocating employees to the Netherlands is a significant investment. When the process goes smoothly, employees settle in faster, stay longer, and perform better. When it doesn't, you risk delays, dissatisfaction, and early departures.
whyChoose.text2: MMRE provides dedicated relocation management that takes the burden off your HR team and ensures every employee receives personal, consistent service.

rentOut.title: Rent Out Your Property with Confidence
rentOut.subtitle: Get a free rental estimate and let us handle everything: marketing, screening, contracts, and ongoing support.
rentOut.freeRentalEstimateText: Fill in your property details and receive an instant estimate plus personalized advice.
rentOut.ourProcessSubtitle: How we help you rent out your property
rentOut.step1Desc: We assess your property and provide a detailed rental valuation based on current market conditions.
rentOut.step2Desc: Professional photos, compelling descriptions, and placement on all major rental platforms.
rentOut.step3Desc: Thorough tenant screening including income verification, references, and background checks.
rentOut.step4Desc: We handle the key handover and remain available for ongoing support throughout the rental period.
rentOut.propertyValuationDesc: Accurate rental price based on market analysis
rentOut.ongoingSupportDesc: Point of contact for you and your tenant
rentOut.servicesForLandlordsText: Legally required measurements and calculations for your rental property. Avoid risks and maximize your rental price.
rentOut.readyToStartText: Get a free rental estimate for your property or speak with our team about your options.
rentOut.complianceWWSDesc: Official point calculation for the maximum allowed rent in regulated rentals.
rentOut.complianceEnergyDesc: Mandatory for rentals and decisive for your WWS points and maximum rent.
rentOut.complianceNENDesc: Official living area measurement — the basis for all calculations.
rentOut.compliancePackageDesc: Complete package: NEN 2580 + Energy Label + WWS in one process.
rentOut.complianceSustainabilityDesc: Practical advice to improve WWS score and rentability.

faq.q1: How much does your service cost?
faq.a1: Our standard fee is one month rent (excl. VAT) for finding a tenant. Additional property management services are available at competitive rates.
faq.q2: How long does it typically take to find a tenant?
faq.a2: On average, we find a qualified tenant within 14 days for properties priced correctly. Premium properties in popular areas often rent faster.
faq.q3: What is included in tenant screening?
faq.a3: We verify employment and income, check references from previous landlords, perform identity verification, and assess overall suitability.
faq.q4: Do you handle the rental contract?
faq.a4: Yes, we prepare a comprehensive rental agreement that protects your interests and complies with Dutch housing law.
faq.q5: What if there are problems with the tenant?
faq.a5: We serve as the first point of contact for any issues and can assist with mediation, maintenance coordination, and if necessary, legal procedures.

wws.title: WWS Point Calculation
wws.subtitle: Professional point calculation for the maximum allowed rent. Avoid risks at the Rent Tribunal.
wws.whatIsText1: The Housing Valuation System (WWS) is the official point system that determines the maximum allowed rent for regulated rental properties in the Netherlands.
wws.whatIsText2: The point calculation is based on objective property characteristics: living area, energy label, facilities, and quality. Each feature earns points, and the total determines whether the property falls in the regulated or free sector.
wws.risk1: Tenant can appeal to the Rent Tribunal
wws.privateLandlordsDesc: You rent out one or a few properties and want certainty about the correct rental price.
wws.propertyInvestorsDesc: You want to optimize your rental income and avoid risks during rent price assessments.
wws.propertyManagersDesc: You manage multiple properties and need reliable WWS documentation for your portfolio.
wws.ourProcessSubtitle: From inspection to report in three steps
wws.step1Desc: We visit the property and inventory all relevant characteristics for the point calculation.
wws.step2Desc: Based on the inspection, we prepare a complete WWS point calculation according to official guidelines.
wws.step3Desc: You receive a clear report with the maximum rent price and any improvement recommendations.
wws.whatWeDeliverText: A professional WWS point calculation that gives you certainty about your rental price.
wws.benefit4: Clear report with maximum rent price
wws.benefit6: Can be combined with Energy Label and NEN 2580
wws.viewCompletePackage: View the complete Rental Compliance package
wws.needWWSText: Contact us for a quote or combine with NEN 2580 and Energy Label for the complete rental compliance package.

energyLabel.title: Energy Label for Rentals
energyLabel.subtitle: Mandatory for rentals and decisive for your WWS points. We handle the energy label completely and correctly.
energyLabel.whatIsText1: A valid energy label is legally required when offering and renting out a property. Without an energy label, you may not advertise and risk a fine.
energyLabel.whatIsText2: But the energy label is more than an obligation: it directly counts in the WWS point calculation and thus partly determines your maximum rent. A better label means more points and potentially more rental income.
energyLabel.wwsImpactText: The difference between an E-label and an A-label can mean tens of WWS points. This can make the difference between regulated and free sector rental.
energyLabel.mandatory1: Without a label, you may not advertise
energyLabel.heating: Type of heating and hot water
energyLabel.step1Desc: A certified EPA advisor visits the property for a complete energy assessment.
energyLabel.step2Desc: Based on the inspection, the energy label is calculated and officially registered.
energyLabel.step3Desc: You receive the official energy label plus insight into the impact on your rental.
energyLabel.moreThanLabelText: We look beyond the certificate alone.
energyLabel.wwsImpactDesc: We calculate how the label affects your WWS points and maximum rent.
energyLabel.improvementPotentialDesc: We advise where small investments quickly yield returns.
energyLabel.compliantRentalDesc: Combine with NEN 2580 and WWS for complete rental compliance.
energyLabel.needEnergyLabelText: Contact us for a quote. Combine with NEN 2580 and WWS point calculation for the complete rental compliance package.

nen2580.title: NEN 2580 Measurement
nen2580.subtitle: The official living area of your property. Basis for energy label, WWS point calculation, and rental contract.
nen2580.whatIsText1: NEN 2580 is the Dutch standard for measuring surface areas in buildings. This standard determines the official usable floor area (GBO) of a property.
nen2580.energyLabelInput: Energy label — area is input for the calculation
nen2580.wwsPoints: WWS point calculation — area directly yields points
nen2580.rentalContract: Rental contract — prevents disputes with tenants
nen2580.consequence1: Incorrect energy label and WWS score
nen2580.foundationText: The NEN 2580 measurement forms the basis for all rental-related calculations. Without correct measurement, energy label and WWS point calculation are unreliable.
nen2580.step1Desc: A professional performs an accurate measurement according to the NEN 2580 standard.
nen2580.step2Desc: We process the measurements into an official floor plan with area calculation.
nen2580.step3Desc: You receive a complete report that is immediately usable for energy label and WWS.
nen2580.whyNENText: The official measurement method that is accepted everywhere.
nen2580.officiallyRecognizedDesc: NEN 2580 is the standard accepted by the government, real estate agents, and the Rent Tribunal.
nen2580.basisForWWSDesc: Area is one of the most important factors in WWS point calculation.
nen2580.preventsDisputesDesc: An official measurement prevents ambiguity in rental contracts or during disputes.
nen2580.needNEN2580Text: Contact us for a quote. Combine with Energy Label and WWS point calculation for the complete rental compliance package.

rentalCompliance.title: Rental Compliance Service
rentalCompliance.subtitle: Everything you need as a landlord in one logical process: NEN 2580 + Energy Label + WWS Point Calculation.
rentalCompliance.whyBundleText: The three components of this package are legally and technically interconnected:
rentalCompliance.nen2580Provides: NEN 2580 provides the area for energy label and WWS
rentalCompliance.energyLabelInput: Energy Label is input for WWS point calculation
rentalCompliance.wwsDetermines: WWS point calculation determines the maximum rent
rentalCompliance.bundleAdvantage: When ordering these three services separately, errors or contradictions often occur in practice. With this package, you can be sure all data is correct and aligned.
rentalCompliance.risk2: Energy label and WWS do not match
rentalCompliance.risk3: Rent Tribunal does not accept documents
rentalCompliance.risk4: Double costs due to re-measurement or correction
rentalCompliance.whatsIncludedSubtitle: Three essential services in one coordinated process
rentalCompliance.nen2580Desc: Official living area measurement — the basis of all calculations.
rentalCompliance.energyLabelDesc: Mandatory for rentals and decisive for WWS points.
rentalCompliance.wwsDesc: Complete point calculation for the maximum allowed rent.
rentalCompliance.forWhomSubtitle: This package is ideal for landlords who want to do things right.
rentalCompliance.avoidRisks: Landlords Who Want to Avoid Risks
rentalCompliance.avoidRisksDesc: You want certainty that your rental complies with all regulations and your rent is correctly substantiated.
rentalCompliance.optimizeDesc: You want to realize the maximum rental price with watertight documentation.
rentalCompliance.portfolioDesc: You manage multiple properties and need consistent, reliable documentation.
rentalCompliance.completeCertaintyText: With this package, you can be sure that you comply with regulations and your rental price is correctly substantiated.
rentalCompliance.benefit1: Single point of contact for everything
rentalCompliance.interestedCompleteText: Contact us for a quote. We discuss your situation and create a tailored proposal.

sustainability.title: Sustainability Advice for Landlords
sustainability.subtitle: Practical advice focused on your property and rental goals: which measures yield WWS points and returns.
sustainability.whySustainabilityText: Sustainability is not only good for the environment — it is increasingly strategically advantageous for landlords:
sustainability.higherWWS: Higher WWS score: a better energy label directly yields more points
sustainability.betterRentability: Better rentability: tenants increasingly choose energy-efficient properties
sustainability.lowerEnergyCosts: Lower energy costs: more attractive for tenants, less vacancy
sustainability.futureRegulations: Future regulations: increasingly strict requirements for rental properties
sustainability.ourAdviceDifferentText: We do not give general sustainability advice. Our advice is specifically focused on your property and your rental goals:
sustainability.whichMeasures: Which measures actually yield WWS points
sustainability.whatProfitable: What is profitable given your rental situation
sustainability.measuresInPerspectiveText: Not every measure is equally effective for your situation
sustainability.actualImpact: The actual impact depends on your specific situation. We calculate it for you.
sustainability.maximizeWWSDesc: We calculate which sustainability measures actually yield WWS points.
sustainability.costVsReturnDesc: Clear overview of investment versus additional rental income and savings.
sustainability.betterRentabilityDesc: An energy-efficient property attracts better tenants and rents faster.
sustainability.futureProofDesc: Already comply with upcoming regulations and maintain your property value.
sustainability.needAdviceText: Contact us and tell us about your property. We calculate which measures are profitable for you.

neighborhoods.title: Amsterdam Neighborhoods
neighborhoods.subtitle: Discover the unique character of Amsterdam's most popular areas

jordaan.name: Jordaan
jordaan.longDescription: The Jordaan is one of Amsterdam's most beloved neighborhoods, known for its narrow streets, beautiful canals, and authentic Amsterdam atmosphere.

dePijp.name: De Pijp
dePijp.description: Vibrant, diverse, and full of life
dePijp.longDescription: De Pijp is a vibrant, multicultural neighborhood famous for the Albert Cuyp Market, excellent restaurants, and lively nightlife.

oudZuid.name: Oud-Zuid
oudZuid.longDescription: Oud-Zuid is Amsterdam's most prestigious neighborhood, home to the Museumplein, Vondelpark, and beautiful 19th-century architecture.

centrum.name: Centrum
centrum.longDescription: The Centrum is Amsterdam's historic core, featuring the famous canal ring, Dam Square, and countless historic buildings.

oost.name: Oost
oost.longDescription: Amsterdam Oost is a diverse, dynamic neighborhood known for the Oosterpark, Dappermarkt, and growing food and arts scene.

west.name: West
west.longDescription: Amsterdam West combines trendy areas like the Foodhallen with family-friendly neighborhoods and beautiful parks.

noord.name: Noord
noord.longDescription: Amsterdam Noord has transformed from industrial area to creative hotspot, with the NDSM wharf, Eye Film Museum, and A'DAM Tower.

zuidoost.name: Zuidoost
zuidoost.description: Modern living and the ArenA area
zuidoost.longDescription: Amsterdam Zuidoost offers modern living with good transport links, the Johan Cruijff ArenA, and diverse communities.

amstelveen.name: Amstelveen
amstelveen.description: Quiet, green suburb popular with families
amstelveen.longDescription: A quiet, green suburb popular with families and expats, offering excellent schools and easy access to Amsterdam.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about renting in Amsterdam
faq.contactUs: We're here to help. Reach out via WhatsApp for a quick response.

general.a1: We primarily focus on Amsterdam and the greater Amsterdam area, including Amstelveen, Diemen, and parts of Noord-Holland. We have deep expertise in all Amsterdam neighborhoods.
general.a2: Our team speaks English, Dutch, and German fluently. We can also assist in French and Spanish for basic communication.
general.a3: The fastest way to reach us is via WhatsApp. You can also email us at info@mmre.nl or fill out our contact form. We typically respond within 15 minutes during business hours.

tenants.q1: What budget should I have for renting in Amsterdam?
tenants.a1: The Amsterdam rental market starts around €1,500/month for studios and small apartments. For a comfortable 2-bedroom apartment in a good area, expect €2,500-3,500/month.
tenants.q2: What documents do I need to rent?
tenants.a2: Typically you need: valid ID/passport, proof of income (employment contract, recent payslips), bank statements, and sometimes a reference from a previous landlord.
tenants.q3: How long does it take to find an apartment?
tenants.a3: This varies based on your requirements and budget. On average, our clients find a suitable home within 2-4 weeks.
tenants.q4: Do you charge tenants a fee?
tenants.a4: No, our services are free for tenants. We are paid by landlords when successfully matching them with qualified tenants.

landlords.a1: Our standard placement fee is one month rent (excluding VAT). Additional property management services are available at competitive monthly rates.
landlords.a2: We verify employment and income (minimum 3x monthly rent), check references from previous landlords, verify identity documents, and assess overall reliability.
landlords.a3: Yes, we offer comprehensive property management including rent collection, maintenance coordination, annual inspections, and tenant communication.
landlords.q4: How do you determine the rental price?
landlords.a4: We analyze comparable properties, current market conditions, property features, and location to recommend an optimal price that maximizes your return.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.subtitle: Clear packages with no hidden fees
pricing.heroSubtitle: Transparent, one-time fees. No hidden costs. No commission on your rent.
pricing.introText1: We believe in clear, upfront pricing. No hidden fees, no commission on your rent. You pay a one-time service fee and we handle everything included in your package.
pricing.introText2: Not sure which package is right for you? Contact us for a free consultation and we'll recommend the best option based on your situation.
pricing.packagesSubtitle: All packages include personal guidance and WhatsApp support

homeFinding.name: Home Finding
homeFinding.description: Focused rental search with full guidance from intake to key handover.

relocationEssentials.name: Relocation Essentials
relocationEssentials.description: Home finding plus essential settling-in services for a smooth start.

fullRelocation.name: Full Relocation
fullRelocation.description: Complete relocation support including immigration and family services.

pricing.corporateText: For companies relocating multiple employees, we offer customized corporate packages with volume pricing, dedicated account management, and consolidated reporting.

faq.a1: You pay after we successfully find and secure your rental home. No upfront fees — we only charge upon completion.
faq.q2: What if you don't find a home?
faq.a2: If we're unable to find a suitable property within the agreed timeframe, you don't pay. No cure, no pay.
faq.a3: No. The package price covers all our services. Third-party costs (like legalization fees or translation) are separate and communicated upfront.
faq.a4: Yes. If your situation doesn't fit neatly into one of our standard packages, contact us and we'll create a tailored solution.

pricing.ctaDescription: Contact us for a free consultation. We'll recommend the best package based on your situation.

howWeWork.title: How We Work
howWeWork.heroSubtitle: A clear, step-by-step process from first contact to key handover.
howWeWork.introText1: We believe in a clear, structured process so you always know what to expect. Whether you're using our home finding service or a full relocation package, the steps below show how we work together.
howWeWork.introText2: Every client gets personal attention — no automated workflows, no chatbots. Just real people guiding you through your move.
howWeWork.servicesSubtitle: The process below applies to our home finding service. For a full relocation, additional steps are included.
howWeWork.homeFindingDesc: Focused on finding and securing your rental home in Amsterdam.
howWeWork.fullRelocationDesc: Home finding plus immigration, settling-in, and family support.
howWeWork.stepsSubtitle: 8 steps from first contact to your new front door

firstContact.title: First Contact
firstContact.description: Reach out via WhatsApp, phone, email, or our contact form. We respond within a few hours during business days.
firstContact.detail1: Tell us what you're looking for
firstContact.detail2: We ask initial questions about your situation

intake.title: Intake & Profile
intake.description: We conduct a detailed intake to understand your needs, preferences, and circumstances.
intake.detail3: Family size, pets, and special requirements

briefing.title: Market Briefing
briefing.description: We set realistic expectations based on current market conditions and your profile.
briefing.detail1: Overview of available stock in your range
briefing.detail2: Average time to find a match

search.title: Active Search
search.description: Our team actively searches for matching properties across all major platforms and our own network.
search.detail3: Pre-screening every option before presenting to you
search.detail4: Quick sharing of suitable properties via WhatsApp

viewings.title: Viewings
viewings.description: We schedule and accompany you to viewings, providing professional assessment of each property.

negotiation.title: Negotiation
negotiation.description: When you find the right home, we negotiate the best possible terms on your behalf.

contract.title: Contract Review
contract.description: We review every clause of the rental contract before you sign.

handover.title: Handover & Keys
handover.description: We guide you through the property handover to ensure everything is documented and in order.

howWeWork.ctaDescription: Send us a message and we'll walk you through the process personally.

whatIsRelocation.title: What is Relocation?
whatIsRelocation.subtitle: Understanding comprehensive relocation services
whatIsRelocation.intro: Relocation services help individuals and families manage all aspects of moving to a new country, from immigration and housing to settling in and integration.
whatIsRelocation.whyNeededText: Moving to a new country involves many complex processes. Professional relocation support ensures nothing falls through the cracks and helps you settle faster.

whatIsHomeFinding.title: What is Home Finding?
whatIsHomeFinding.subtitle: Understanding aanhuur: the Dutch concept of having a rental agent work for you
whatIsHomeFinding.intro: In the Netherlands, there are two types of rental agents. The verhuurmakelaar works for the landlord, while the aanhuurmakelaar (home finding agent) works for the tenant.
whatIsHomeFinding.differenceText: A home finding agent represents your interests exclusively. Unlike the landlord's agent, we search, negotiate, and advocate on your behalf.
whatIsHomeFinding.benefit1: Access to listings across multiple platforms
whatIsHomeFinding.benefit3: Negotiation on rental price and terms

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.subtitle: Sorry, we couldn't find the page you're looking for.
